How to Install enscript on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • enscript

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install enscript on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing enscript on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall enscript in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install enscript, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install enscript Using apt

To install enscript in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install enscript using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install enscript

The installation of enscript might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install enscript Using apt-get

To install enscript using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install enscript.

sudo apt-get -y install enscript

Install enscript Using Synaptic

To install enscript using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install enscript on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for enscript. This will display the enscript package in the package window, now to install enscript, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the enscript package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of enscript.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install enscript Using aptitude

To install enscript on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of enscript.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install enscript using the command aptitude install enscript.

sudo aptitude -y install enscript

How to Upgrade enscript on debian

If you want to upgrade the enscript package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade enscript using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade enscript to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade enscript.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade enscript sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade enscript

Upgrade enscript using Aptitude

To upgrade enscript using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade enscript.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade enscript

Upgrade enscript using Synaptic

To upgrade enscript using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for enscript, now right-click enscript, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade enscript just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall enscript on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall enscript from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just enscript, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove enscript

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of enscript

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of enscript you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge enscript

Remove enscript using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall enscript using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for enscript, right-click the enscript package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall enscript click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install enscript on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade enscript using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
